articles.description: WANDERERS front man Dion Charles looked in good touch as he came off the bench to ease some pressure on his Northern Ireland boss Ian Barraclough.
articles.content:
DION Charles gave Northern Ireland boss Ian Barraclough a timely nudge as he helped rescue a draw against Cyprus at Windsor Park.
The Wanderers striker has played just 55 minutes in four Nations Lea… [+2511 chars]

articles.author: Nick Ames
articles.title: England’s attack has lost its rhythm with Southgate suddenly short of options - The Guardian
articles.description: An attacking unit that seemed to be overloaded with talent has become too reliant on Harry Kane and Raheem Sterling
articles.content: It spoke volumes for the slog England and Italy produced on Saturday that, by the end, what did not happen seemed more telling than the little that did. England did not click in attack and did not cr… [+6099 chars]

articles.author: Gordon Parks
articles.title: Steve Clarke breaks Scotland habit of a lifetime in honest admission over Armenia showdown - Daily Record
articles.description: The national team boss usually refrains from branding matches a must win but accepts anything less simply won't do.
articles.content:
Steve Clarke admits Scotlands savaging from Ireland has created a Nations League win-or-bust scenario against Armenia. 
 The Scotland boss broke the habit of a lifetime by conceding anything less th… [+3457 chars]

articles.title: Newcastle 'confident' of bringing £30m star to St James' Park - GIVEMESPORT
articles.description: Newcastle United are confident that they can sign one of their key targets this summer despite alleged interest from Paris Saint-Germain.
articles.content:
Newcastle United are confident that they can sign Sven Botman, according to talkSPORT reporter Alex Crook.
